title: UNIX/Linux Programming
subtitle: Master the shell, scripting, and system-level programming

topics.title: Introduction to UNIX/Linux
topics.description: Overview of UNIX/Linux OS, architecture, distributions, and shell.

topics.title: Basic Shell Commands
topics.description: File operations, directory navigation, permissions, and process control.

topics.title: File System & Permissions
topics.description: Understanding file structure, chmod, chown, and file types.

topics.title: Shell Scripting
topics.description: Writing shell scripts with variables, conditions, loops, and functions.

topics.title: Process Management
topics.description: Foreground/background jobs, ps, top, kill, signals, and process control.

topics.title: Text Processing Tools
topics.description: Using grep, sed, awk, cut, sort, uniq for powerful text operations.

topics.title: VI Editor & Bash Customization
topics.description: Using VI editor, .bashrc customization, aliases, and environment variables.

topics.title: Networking & System Calls
topics.description: Basic networking commands, system programming in C with open, read, fork.
